snippet: “No Man’s Land: Fiction From a World at War 1914-1918” and “The Burning of the World” bring diverse voices to World War I literature.
abstract: Larry Rohter reviews books No Man's Land: Fiction From a World at War: 1914-1918 edited by Pete Ayrton and The Burning of the World: A Memoir of 1914 by Bela Zombory-Moldovan.
lead_paragraph: “No Man’s Land: Fiction From a World at War 1914-1918” and “The Burning of the World” bring diverse voices to World War I literature.

headline.seo: ‘No Man’s Land,’ Unfamiliar Writing About World War I
headline.main: Delving Deep Into the Crannies of a Brutal War
headline.print_headline: Delving Deep Into the Crannies of a Brutal War
